body_html: If doing nothing is bad, then instead you could have it print a warning. Or alternatively you could add an argument to .cuda like fail_silently that defaults to False, but can be made true if the user wants it to check if cuda is available before trying to do anything. Equivalently a function called .try_cuda would make that intent pretty clear in the code.

body: If doing nothing is bad, then instead you could have it print a warning. Or alternatively you could add an argument to .cuda like fail_silently that defaults to False, but can be made true if the user wants it to check if cuda is available before trying to do anything. Equivalently a function called .try_cuda would make that intent pretty clear in the code.
